attributes.action: Declare a Freedom Week once enough people are vaccinated against COVID-19
attributes.background: To allow people and businesses to recover after a year of extraordinary restrictions, the Government should extend pub opening hours, allow all entertainment to open longer, and remove taxes on alcohol and restaurant meals.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want the Government to make changes to acknowledge progress with its Covid-19 vaccination programme, but it's not clear exactly what changes you want the Government to make, or when.
                
You could start a new petition explaining more clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, including what proportion of the population you think should be vaccinated before Covid-19 restrictions and taxes are changed in the way you request.
